output_data.clarification_question: To establish a definitive primary diagnosis (DSM-5 Criterion B & C), please provide the full symptom cluster (Criterion A, at least 5 of 9 required) and confirm if the symptoms cause clinically significant distress or impairment. Specifically, how many of the 9 MDD criteria are currently endorsed?
output_data.suggested_answer: Based on the doctor's reference to monitoring treatment response at the 4-week mark ('at 4 weeks we usually hope to see some spark'), the clinical context strongly suggests an active Major Depressive Episode. We will proactively map this as Major Depressive Disorder, Single Episode, Moderate, pending symptom confirmation.

primary_diagnosis.description: Major depressive disorder, single episode, moderate
primary_diagnosis.justification: Inference based on the existing shared transcript which indicates active pharmacological treatment monitoring for depression. This code assumes the patient meets at least five depressive criteria for a minimum of two weeks, causing moderate functional impairment, and has no history of mania or hypomania.
dsm_criteria_met: Criterion A (Inferred: Depressed mood or Anhedonia plus 3-4 associated symptoms)

ruled_out.reason: Insufficient information to determine if this is a first episode or a recurrence.
No evidence of manic or hypomanic episodes reported in the limited available context.
